creditline: Gift of Stuart P. Feld, Class of 1957, and Mrs. Feld
inscribed:
in brown ink, lower left, different ink: Croquis que hiso Mariano Fortuny | en Portici -ano 1874. | "La Sra de Agrasot que está bordano"
in ink, lower right: a Dn Matías Errázuriz | dedica este dibujo original | de Mariano Fortuny | Su amigo | Ricardo de Madrazo [underlined] | Madrid [2 de De] 1907
in graphite, on verso along left edge (partially erased): Bfor 24-28 (…) [Vive reads the date as “Madrid 28 (…) 1907”]

texts.textentryhtml: This intimate drawing depicts Emma Agrasot, the wife of Fortuny’s friend and fellow artist Joaquín Agrasot. The Fortuny and Agrasot families first met in Rome, and during the summer of 1874 they shared the Villa Arata, near Naples. There, Fortuny frequently depicted Emma engaged in such domestic tasks as sewing or embroidery.
Mr. and Mrs. Stuart P. Feld, Class of 1957, New York<!--?xml:namespace prefix = "o" ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /--><o:p></o:p>
